roleset.name: cause to become level
roleset.note: LEVEL-V NOTES: Frames file for 'level' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. No comparison. (from level.01-v predicate notes)

roles.note: Arg2 from the verb omitted, as it is unlikely. (from level.01-j)

example.name: all args
example.text: John levelled the cup of flour with the bottom of his shoe.
example.arg: with the bottom of his shoe

example.name: boom
example.text: In May 1988, [an ammonium perchlorate plant in Henderson owned by an American Pacific Corp. unit]-1 was leveled [*-1]by a series of explosions.

roleset.name: direct emphatically
roleset.note: LEVEL-V NOTES: Frames file for 'level' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. No comparison. (from level.03-v predicate notes)

example.name: take that!
example.text: [Warner Communications Inc. and Sony Corp.]-1 resumed settlement talks on their legal battle over Hollywood producers Peter Guber and Jon Peters, but continued [*-1]to level strong accusations at each other in legal documents.

roleset.name: even, flat, uniformly horizontal
roleset.note: LEVEL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, flat-j.01, level-v.01, which corresponds to VNcls other_cos-45.5. (from level.01-j)

roles.note: Arg2 from the verb omitted, as it is unlikely.

example.name: arg1
example.text: Eygpt , probably because they 're comparitively level and calm . -LRB- I said comparatively -RRB- .

roleset.name: level off: become level, even
roleset.note: LEVEL_OFF-V NOTES: See vn class other_cos-45.4, but verb particle construction isn't present in class (from level.02-v)

example.name: unaccusative
example.text: [ECONOMIC GROWTH]-1 APPEARS *trace*-1 to be leveling off, latest reports suggest.

example.name: agentive
example.text: John levelled off the cup of flour with the bottom of his shoe.
example.arg: with the bottom of his shoe
